sen.j: 味噌漬け（みそづけ）は、野菜、肉、魚などを味噌に漬けたものである。
sen.e: Misozuke is vegetable, meat, or fish pickled in miso paste (bean paste).
sen.cmt: 読点で一文が区切られていたため、一文にして訳しました。
sen.e: Misozuke is vegetable, meat, or fish pickled in miso paste (bean paste).
Misozuke is vegetable, meat, or fish pickled in miso paste (bean paste).

sen.j: 塩のきいた漬物であり、よく貯蔵にたえる。
sen.e: It is salty tsukemono (Japanese pickles) and preserves for a long time.
It is salty tsukemono (Japanese pickles) and preserves for a long time.
It is salty tsukemono (Japanese pickles) and preserves for a long time.

sen.j: 味噌は主として赤味噌である。
sen.e: Dark-brown miso paste is usually used.
Dark-brown miso paste is usually used.
Dark-brown miso paste is usually used.

sen.j: ぬかみそを用いる一般的な漬物と異なる点は、味噌そのものが食用、調味料として用いられる点である。
sen.e: What is different from pickles made in rice-bran paste is that miso paste itself is for eating and seasoning.
What is different from pickles made in rice-bran paste is that miso paste itself is for eating and seasoning.
What is different from pickles made in rice-bran paste is that miso paste itself is for eating and seasoning.

sen.j: 特に香りや味などに味噌の風味が移るのが喜ばれる。
sen.e: Especially permeated flavor of miso paste is favored.
Especially permeated flavor of miso paste is favored.
Especially permeated flavor of miso paste is favored.

sen.j: ダイコン、ニンジン、ゴボウ、キュウリなど漬け込む食材は日乾しか陰干ししたものを用い、またはいちど塩漬けののちに水分を切って漬ける。
sen.e: Pickled ingredients such as Japanese white radish, carrot, burdock root, or cucumber, are used after they are sun-dried or after kageboshi (drying a thing in the shade), or after once pickled in salt and drained.

Pickled ingredients such as Japanese white radish, carrot, burdock root, or cucumber, are used after they are sun-dried or after kageboshi (drying a thing in the shade), or after once pickled in salt and drained.

Pickled ingredients such as Japanese white radish, carrot, burdock root, or cucumber, are used after they are sun-dried or after kageboshi (drying a thing in the shade), or after once pickled in salt and drained.

sen.j: 一例としてナスの味噌漬けについて述べれば、初秋に採り入れたナスをへたのついたまま洗う。
sen.e: For example, to make Misozuke of eggplants, pick eggplants in the beginning of fall and wash them with the calyx.
For example, to make Misozuke of eggplants, pick eggplants in the beginning of fall and wash them with the calyx.
For example, to make Misozuke of eggplants, pick eggplants in the beginning of fall and wash them with the calyx.

sen.j: 塩3.6リットル、水4.5リットルの塩水に3日間から4日間重しをして漬ける。
sen.e: Pickle them in salty water of 3.6 l of salt and 4.5 l of water for three to four days with weight.
Pickle them in salty water of 3.6 liter of salt and 4.5 liter of water for three to four days with weight.
Pickle them in salty water of 3.6 liter of salt and 4.5 liter of water for three to four days with weight.

sen.j: 取り出し、水気を切って1日ほど風にかわかす。
sen.e: Take them out from the water, drain, and dry in the air for about a day.
Take them out from the water, drain, and dry in the air for about a day.
Take them out from the water, drain, and dry in the air for about a day.

sen.j: 上等な赤味噌3kgを1.26リットルないし1.44リットルのみりんでゆるめたものと、上に述べたナス3.75kgと互い違いに層をなすように漬け込む。
sen.e: Pile up dark-brown miso paste of good quality with 1.26 to 1.44 liter of mirin (sweet cooking rice wine) and 3.75 kgs of the eggplants of the above alternately.
Pile up dark-brown miso paste of good quality with 1.26 to 1.44 liter of mirin (sweet cooking rice wine) and 3.75 kgs of the eggplants of the above alternately.
Pile up dark-brown miso paste of good quality with 1.26 to 1.44 liter of mirin (sweet cooking rice wine) and 3.75 kgs of the eggplants of the above alternately.

sen.j: 上面にはタケの皮で蓋をして目張りをして半年くらい冷所に静置する。
sen.e: Seal the top with bamboo skin and store in cool place after sealing up.
Seal the top with bamboo skin and store in cool place for about half a year after sealing up.
Seal the top with bamboo skin and store in cool place for about half a year after sealing up.

sen.j: さらに長期漬けるには新しい味噌と交換するのがよい。
sen.e: If you want to pickle for a longer time, it is better to replace with new miso paste.
If you want to pickle for a longer time, it is better to replace with new miso paste.
If you want to pickle for a longer time, it is better to replace with new miso paste.
